website_summaries.verdict: One anchor buoy option that is best used in combination with other buoys for complete protection.
pros: Comes in various small sizes and colors to mix and match as needed
Vinyl exterior resists warping and bursting when sandwiched between the side of the dock and a boat
cons: Included rope may fray or break after a couple of uses, requiring new replacement lines

customer_reviews.title: Can't inflate
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this. This size would fit my needs, however, it does not come with an inflater valve. If you do pressurize it, their air all comes out while you try to screw the plug back in. No instructions on how to inflate it. Look for a different make/model that has this valve ...
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Material
customer_reviews.text: I took it out deep sea the other day. I only purchase this as a back up to potentially save my anchor if needed. I didn't need it this trip but I will say it is made from some very good material. I have noticed some complaining about filling the ball with air. I just used my air compressor with a "blow gun" attachment...lol...it was quick and easy and a regular screw driver to tighten the screw.
customer_reviews.author: Will Tsang

customer_reviews.title: Finally got to use this thing. Anchor was stuck ...
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to use this thing. Anchor was stuck and not come up. Attached this thing to the rope and put the boat in reverse and after a few seconds of it being submerged the anchor pulled up. Once I retrieved the anchor a tree root was attached to it so it does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: T. Klotzbach

customer_reviews.title: Not only an anchor puller!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an alternative use. I am using it to keep the intake for a water pump from dropping into the weeds and mud. There were no instructions for how to inflate the buoy (shipped uninflated) but I found the inlet. My 12V air pump had a fitting that would insert into the buoy. It would be helpful if inflation directions and the proper inflation device were included with the buoy.
customer_reviews.author: Chinggisron

customer_reviews.title: Wish I bought one years ago
customer_reviews.text: If you have never seen one of these things work I highly suggest watching a video or asking a friend. Ridiculously easy to retrieve our plow style anchor
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: absolutely wouldn't boat without it!
customer_reviews.text: The quality is superb! It lifts my 16 lb clam style anchor with ease! Ball is good quality, so is the rope, and the ring is stainless along with the carabiner. Also important is that the carabiner is of good size, and this one is.
customer_reviews.author: michael cruz

customer_reviews.title: Back saving device
customer_reviews.text: The system looks to be pretty tough with the exception of the braided rope. I will be replacing that soon. Didn't have any issues with airing up the buoy and the clip seems to be pretty strong. Awesome system for retrieving the anchor, definitely a back saver and a must have for deep water fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Makes Anchoring Easier
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Makes getting the anchor free from the bottom and up to the surface from deeper water a lot less work than pulling it all up by hand. It would be nice if a long inflation needle was included in the package. Using a standard size needle (i.e., the size for a football, soccer ball, etc.) and hand air pump doesn't work for the anchor ball.
customer_reviews.author: Fly Navy Law

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work reliably for me
customer_reviews.text: I have a 25 Manson anchor on a 29' sailboat. This system worked half the time for me. A few times it freed the anchor, but did not move the buoy all the way to the anchor, so retrieval was difficult. The other times it would not free the anchor, even when getting the sailboat to 6 mph and following the instructions. The bow would jerk around, or the anchor would reset.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G. Bringle

customer_reviews.title: Works a treat
customer_reviews.text: Hi guys, I have had a chance to test this sea anchor out in 60 metres of water. It works and removes a lot of the strain on the backs given that the retriever can hold a solid anchor on the surface. So all you are doing is retrieving a floating anchor instead of trying to pull the anchor from the bottom. Highly recommend and nice price for what it can do for your fishing experience.
customer_reviews.author: Chee Tan

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Quick ship. Works as expected. Easily floats my 12lb. anchor from 40-100 ft. where I usually fish the reef. Saves a lot of wear and tear on my back.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C.

customer_reviews.title: No rope or ring sent!
customer_reviews.text: Anchor ball came but no rope or ring sent? Disappointed going to send ball back!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. Drags my 40 pound river anchor right up.
customer_reviews.author: Tamra Szubart

customer_reviews.title: Anchor ball
customer_reviews.text: This product makes fishing alone in Intracoastal waters much safer. I can raise my anchor with ease without a second man on board. Watched some YouTube videos on anchor balls before making purchase. High quality materials, very durable.
customer_reviews.author: MBishop

customer_reviews.title: Well made anchor ring/puller
customer_reviews.text: I hope I never have to use this to pull up my anchor but it would be a great way to retrieve an anchor when your anchored in very deep water. The video is a must watch. I bought it to keep from losing a $100 anchor, $50 of chain, and 200 feet of anchor rope.
customer_reviews.author: RCW

customer_reviews.title: Issue with valve
customer_reviews.text: The item could not hold air. Disclaimer: i'm not exactly sure of I inflated it correctly, perhaps damaging the valve, but point is that it did not hold air.
customer_reviews.author: Vicente

customer_reviews.title: I used this for the first time in about 50ft ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time in about 50ft of water on sandy bottom - it worked exactly as advertised. I don't have a windlass and pulling the anchor is a pain. I did 2mph until anchor freed and then a bit faster until anchor was under the float.
customer_reviews.author: Henry L.

customer_reviews.title: Comes partially deflated
customer_reviews.text: Arrived, but no directions on how to fill. Disappointing as purchased for someone else who had to call and ask me directions or if it was damaged. Found this to be a trend in other comments, hopefully directions for filling will be included in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie C

customer_reviews.title: I am sure it will work fine as soon as I figure out how to inflate the ball.
customer_reviews.text: I am optimistic the product will work, but why sell this with no way to inflate the bouy. It doesn't come with any way to inflate, BRILLIANT!!! Why don't you raise the price $3 and include the adapter to inflate.
customer_reviews.author: Swampbeaver

customer_reviews.title: No issues i may not show the kids
customer_reviews.text: My old anchor windlass left and went to college. I used it last weekend in 60 to 90 ft of water. Works great had to double up on my wire tie that inverts my anchor if it gets snagged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: The Anchor ring anchor puller is exactly what we needed. It is much easier hauling in our anchor with this tool. The bouy is a good size and fits well in my boats storage bin.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This item makes retrieving my anchor so much easier. I wished I would of purchased it earlier. When used as directed this product takes much of the work out of bringing up the anchor. I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: S. Hinds

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my 20 foot walk around no problem very ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my 20 foot walk around no problem very simple to use no more back straining her having to pull this massive boat anchor off the seafloor system works perfect
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: The ball works fine raising the anchor but the clip on was not ...
customer_reviews.text: The ball works fine raising the anchor but the clip on was not strong enough and came off. I replaced it with a carabiner that I know will not come off.
customer_reviews.author: Spitzerone

customer_reviews.title: great ball, lanyard might not hold up to long ...
customer_reviews.text: great ball, lanyard might not hold up to long but a new piece of rope will fix that..price is right
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I've been made missing out on this my entire life. This is a game changer! Anchor ball works perfect
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best price you'll find on this critical piece of equipment. I can't imagine weighing anchor without this!
customer_reviews.author: B and B

customer_reviews.title: great item, and works great
customer_reviews.text: great item, and works great. Took it on first fishing trip and pulled anchor from 80 foot of water with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tom L.

customer_reviews.title: My son living it
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my son and he loves it
customer_reviews.author: Roxcy Echard

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with this gizmo. It has worked to free my anchor several times. A boater must have!
customer_reviews.author: Josh Kripas

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for an Alaska trip in August 2017 where ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an Alaska trip in August 2017 where I'll have to do all the anchor lifting. I've seen others work well, so wanted to have one myself to make it easier for me.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne T

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I'm still amazed at this anchor retrieval method . It's a must for deep water anchoring .
customer_reviews.author: ELton

customer_reviews.title: 13# anchor came up easily and locked into to ring
customer_reviews.text: Received as stated. Used it several days later in 120 ft of water off the coast of Florida and it worked as stated. 13# anchor came up easily and locked into to ring. Stopped and retrieved anchor rode, chain, and anchor with no exertion
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Arm saver.
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Good quality, should last year's. Easily pulls up my 13 lb Danforth with 15 foot of chain.
customer_reviews.author: John Adams

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm first time anchored in 90 feet of water. No longer have to manually lift from 90’
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Could not be happier. Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: product is exactly as stated. Could not be happier. Works like a charm! Great addition to any boat! Buoy is bright yellow very visible in the water. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kmnet

customer_reviews.title: but we're glad we got the 15
customer_reviews.text: We thought about getting the 11" Buoy, but we're glad we got the 15.5" It works great!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great item.
customer_reviews.text: Use it one time and you'll never pull a anchor again the way you use too. Great item.
customer_reviews.author: C. Masters

customer_reviews.title: If I had the anchor ball last week I would ...
customer_reviews.text: If I had the anchor ball last week I would still have an anchor. All boaters you must keep one on your boat
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it works great with my 18lb seaclaw anchor and chain
customer_reviews.author: Shane kelly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The most amazing way to pull up an anchor!!! I'll never have to wrench my back again:)
customer_reviews.author: R. K. Twist

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Shipping time was excellent. The anchor retriever works as advertised. I am pleased withy purchase
customer_reviews.author: larry phillips

customer_reviews.title: Awesome system
customer_reviews.text: Received anchor ring puller with float ball and had to use the system first day out due to my anchor was stuck on bottom in 42' of water. Connected ring to line and operated boat at 30 degree angle from anchor. Amazed at how well the system brought the anchor to top of water. Purchased one for my brother to use in the Chesapeake Bay.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Morrow

customer_reviews.title: So-so
customer_reviews.text: Rope was not braided well, so I'll probably have to replace. Overall, wasn't too pleased with quality of this aspect. Otherwise, okay.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Holter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, however had a bit of a funky smell upon taking it out of the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold air
customer_reviews.text: My buoy does not hold air, and deflates after a few days. Super annoying. David
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. I anchor out in 150+ feet of water at times and this thing works flawlessly. I'll never pull up another anchor by hand again.
customer_reviews.author: C-man

product_meta.title: Ironwood Pacific Anchor Ring Anchor Puller with 11" Buoy (up to 30 lb Lift) or 15" Buoy (up to 60 lb Lift)
product_meta.description:
Our easy to use Ironwood Pacific Anchor Ring takes the challenge out of hauling your anchor by hand. It has been specially designed for offshore anchoring, where longer lengths of chain are frequently used and proves stronger than similar welded rings due to the specific engineering of this Anchor Ring. If you are looking for exceptional performance and value – this Anchor Ring is for you!

Directions For Use

To use the Anchor Ring, you would begin by slipping the ring over the anchor line and attaching the shackle-buoy assembly. You would then motor your boat forward at around 5 knots to start, keeping the anchor line clear of the prop. Increase your speed slightly when the anchor starts to break free and the anchor line will slide through the ring, raising the anchor, as the buoy floats on the surface.

Anchor Ring Construction

The Anchor Ring is available in two models; our standard model, constructed form ¼” stainless steel, is ideal for use with anchors up to 20 pounds while our heavy-duty model, constructed from 5/16” stainless steel and can lift up to 80 pounds. Both Anchor rings are made in the USA and come with a lifetime warranty.

Buoy 

The Polyform Buoy is a favorite among fishermen as it can endure even the most adverse conditions. Made from extra strength, flexible vinyl, the polyform makes a great marker or mooring buoy and can also work effectively as a boat fender. The reinforced rope-hold is molded to the body in a single process and won’t separate with the strongest pull. Choose between the 11” for a 28 pound lift and the 14.5” for a 60 pound lift. All Polyform products are manufactured in the USA and come with a lifetime warranty.
feature_bullets: Will float anchors or traps up to 80 lbs Use with anchor lines rigged with more than 15' of chain Quickly clips to anchor line Easy, affordable solution for anchor retrieval Lifetime warranty
